description.narrative: The focus of the intervention is on scaled up climate change mitigation and adaptation and strengthened resilience capacities to cope with natural and man-made shocks and stresses.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Institute for Training and Research

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: United Nations Institute for Training and Research
United Nations Institute for Training and Research
United Nations Institute for Training and Research

description.narrative:
Output 1. Scaled up action on climate change adaptation and mitigation in vulnerable districts is funded and implemented Output 1: End of project target: Indicator 1.1. 5000 households ( Aggregated by Male and Female-led) using climate-smart agriculture production technologies and sustainable energy practices under SE4All initiative Indicator 1.2. A total of 15 community groups developing gender sensitive adaptation strategies and measures for climate resilience in 5 districts Indicator 1.3. 1 gender sensitive national adaptation plan and 5 district development plans that address biodiversity and ecosystem management and climate risk management
Output 2: Mechanisms in place to assess and mitigate natural and man-made risks at the subnational level Mid term and end of project target: Indicator 2. 1. By 2020, 5 gender sensitive district development plans that address disaster and risk management have been adopted Indicator 2.2: By December 2017, 3 multi-hazard mappings at subnational levels have been carried out and inform planning and programming, taking into account differentiated impact on women and men.

comment.narrative:
Output 1. Scaled up action on climate change adaptation and mitigation in vulnerable districts is funded and implemented Baseline: to be determined by baseline studies
Output 2: Mechanisms in place to assess and mitigate natural and man-made risks at the subnational level Baseline: 2.1. to be determined by baseline studies 2.2. Nil
1. Complete borehole drilling and water conveyancing in Bulilima, Lupane and Gokwe South
1. Completed borehole drilling and water conveyancing in Bulilima, Lupane and Gokwe South

2019 Targets Output 1 Recommendations for climate policy, planning and programming are incorporated in the national frameworks and the Enhanced Transparency Framework (ETF)
Output 2 i. Key district level stakeholders express increased understanding and capacity of Climate Change Adaptation and DRR due to awareness and planning support materials ii. Recommendations for DRM and climate policy, planning and programming are incorporated in the national frameworks for DRM iii. Vegetable processing centre building erected and beneficiaries express increased resilience to climate change impacts, improved income generation options and climate proofing of livelihoods iv. Malalume Clinic provided with piped water and school climate smart school nutrition garden established v. Honey processing building erected and CSA, wetland protection and market linkage knowledge increased vi. One additional ward development committee trained in DRR preparedness and CCA in each district

2019 - Quarter 3 Output 1: Input from COPs provided to climate act
Output 2: i. Implementation of additional community-based disaster risk management training and follow-up training for wards trained in 2018 were done. Bulilima to do additional training. iii.- v.: Outstanding borehole and solar power installations completed for Bulilima, Lupane and Gokwe South sites. At Malalume Secondary School the solar system is now powering lighting for the classrooms and teachers houses pumping ground water for use by the school and surrounding community. At Zinaphi, the project completed the water conveyance system to augment the water from the wetlands and the provision water troughs for domestic animals outside the bounds of the irrigation scheme and sensitive wetland areas. Mubvumbi Nutrition Garden water for domestic use by the community is now available for use at designated points outside the gardens. For Q2-Q4 2019, synergies and cost sharing agreed with UNDP IGSL project on SECA provision of solar power for Lupane honey processing centre and solar power for Gokwe South vegetable processing centre, whereas IGSL covers construction of buildings. Additional allocation received in July for consolidating micro projects. IGSL investments have happened, follow up SECA investments to be made Q4 2019.
UN:CC learn project on joint UNDP UNITAR learning strategy channeled through SECA as per august 2019. Revised workplan incorporating UN CC learn work agreed at Q3 board meeting.

Support to Post COP 25 Activities and plans for COP 26 Borehole and Solar installations in 2 districts GCF Prodoc and support towards LPAC National Climate Change Learn Strategy Climate promise activities funded towards revision of the NDC

A post COP 25 workshop was held and the workshop recommended that the country should immediately commence the nationalization of the UNFCCC Gender Action Plan. The two boreholes could not be completed due to technical challenges GCF ProDoc Developed and finalized and cleared by UNDP HQ with a few comments The Climate Change Learning Strategy Background and Needs Assessment Report have been finalized Climate promise activities have been funded and implementation is underway.

i. National Adaptation Plan stocktake document finalised ii. 2017 HDR finalised and launched iii. National Climate Policy Launched. RE policy approved iv. Roadmap developed to establish National Climate Fund v. Recommendations on Energy policy and LEDS provided vi. Recommendations on the SDG 13 and other environment cluster SDGs implementation incorporated in the the LEDS and NAP vii.Recommendations on planning, policy, strategy, programming, funding incorporated in the LEDS and NAP viii. GCF proposal finalised. Mitigation concept note developed
Output 2: Mechanisms in place to assess and mitigate natural and man-made risks at the subnational level i. Updated DRM plans for Bulilima, Gokwe South, Lupane by mid year 2018 with reference to CCA ii. Recommendations provided for DRM in policy, planning and programming. iii. Key district level stakeholders express increased understanding and capacity of Climate Change Adaptation and DRR due to awareness and planning support materials iv. Recommendations for DRM and climate policy, planning and programming are incorporated in the national frameworks for DRM i v. Solar powered water supply systems and weather station installed. Beneficiaries have increased understanding of the RE technology and are able to maintain the RE and weather installations. vi. Solar powered water supply systems installed and school electrified. Beneficiaries have increased understanding of the RE technology and are able to maintain the RE installation. vii. Irrigation system rehabilitated and solar powered ground water systems installed. Beneficiaries have increased understanding of the RE technology and are able to maintain the RE installation. Beneficiaries protect the wetland and use water more efficiently.
Output 3: Project effectively planned, implemented and monitored i. MEWC Officials trained in M&E. 2018 M&E plan and tools developed and used to assess progress and effect of interventions. ii. AWP, 4 costed QWP, 4 Quarterly reports and budgets. iii. UNV officers show increased understanding and capacity iiii. Mid term internal reviev completed by end of 2018

i. National Adaptation Plan stocktake document not yet finalized. The NAP process has been facing challenges with the engaged consultants team (under Integrated Planning Systems project), which has not been able to deliver in time and to agreed quality. The final draft was delivered December 21, 2018 and the Climate Change Management Department, the Environmental Management Agency and the UNDP will now finalise the report early 2019. ii. 2017 HDR finalised and launched Friday 16th March 2018 with participation of the then Minister of Environment, Water and Climate, the UNDP Administrator and the Office of the President. The event generated good attention of the climate risks faced by Zimbabwe and spinned off into a youth event in September 2018, which saw a large degree of interest among youth. iii. National Climate Policy was launched in 2018. The RE policy is still pending approval, the Min of Energy and Power Development is currently pushing for the policy to go through cabinet and has been assured that it will be tabled for cabinet in first quarter 2019. iv. Roadmap developed to establish National Climate Fund. The sister project STIZ NDC took up this objective, see project 00102630 Support to Implementing Zimbabwes NDC. v. Recommendations on Energy policy and LEDS were provided from the MoEPD participation in IRENA meetings. vi. Recommendations on the SDG 13 and other environment cluster SDGs implementation were not incorporated into the LEDS and NAP processes as the Climate Change Management Department did not participate in the 2018 SDG summit on behalf of GoZ. vii. However the CCMD participated in the COP 24 and the meetings leading up to the COP in Bonn and Bangkok and provided valuable recommendations on planning, policy, strategy, programming, funding especially for the LEDS process in terms of guidance on the transparency requirements and the guidelines for the LEDS itself. viii. The GCF adaptation proposal was finalized and submitted in October 2018. Now awaiting feedback from GCF early 2019.
Output 2: Mechanisms in place to assess and mitigate natural and man-made risks at the subnational level i. DRM plans for Bulilima, Gokwe South, Lupane were updated mid year 2018 and makes reference to CCA based on district level DRM-CCA trainings. ii. Recommendations provided for DRM in policy, planning and programming. The Met Services Dept. and the Department for Civil Protection did provide feedback from the Southern Africa Seasonal Forecasting meeting for planning for the upcoming El Nino. iii. Key district level stakeholders express increased understanding and capacity of Climate Change Adaptation and DRR due to awareness and planning support materials. 140 Ward committee members were trained in DRM and CCA as part of district level community based DRR management work, expressed improved understanding and went on to design own community / ward DRM plans. iv. 2 x Boreholes have been drilled and weather station installed in Gokwe South. Solar powered water supply systems to be installed Jan 2019. vi. 1x Borehole has been drilled in Bulilima. Solar powered water supply systems to be installed Jan 2019. vii. 2x Boreholes have been drilled in Lupane. Solar powered water supply systems to be installed Jan 2019.
Output 3: Project effectively planned, implemented and monitored i. MEWC Officials trained in M&E. M&E plan and tools will be developed and used to assess progress and effect of interventions in 2019. ii. AWP, 4 costed QWP, 4 Quarterly reports and budgets produced. iii. UNV officers show and express increased understanding and capacity iiii. Mid term internal review not completed. To be budgeted for first quarter 2019.
